data.description: The Global Safety & Security Team falls under the Operations Division that runs many day-to-day operational functions that help keep our employees safe, happy and productive. We work closely with leadership and employees to ensure that Datadog continues to scale rapidly, yet smoothly, and remains a fantastic place to work.We’re seeking an experienced team member to join our growing global team and play a critical role in keeping Datadogs and its assets safe and secure. You will work directly with the Head of Global Safety & Security and cross-functional teams to support safety and security operations across the enterprise. Ideal candidates will be passionate about leadership, security operations, building programs, workplace health and safety, project management, customer service, and collaboration. This position is based in our NYC office and will require domestic and international travel. The role will focus particularly on developing our protective services, headquarters security, incident and crisis management programs.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What You’ll Do:Manage day-to-day global safety and security operations for Datadog’s regional offices in AMER, including its global HQ in NYC and assist with global safety and security initiatives.Oversee a variety of responsibilities, including investigations, health and safety compliance, security risk management, travel safety, event security, budgeting, crisis management, emergency response, property loss management, and global safety and security system management. Enforce Datadog’s security policies and regulations regionally.Document and disseminate security protocols under the guidance of the Head of Global Safety and Security. Develop enterprise-wide access control standards, policies, technical security solutions, safety protocols, emergency preparedness training, and liaise with local law enforcement in individual offices.Collaborate with various teams, including Office Operations, Real Estate, IT, Legal, Executive Assistants, Events and People teams. Maintain regular communication with stakeholders to ensure alignment on global safety and security initiatives, and ensure all teams are trained on emergency plans and incident response protocols.Execute daily operations and strategic initiatives for workplace safety and security, contract security personnel management, and response to incidents in Datadog offices.Identify long-term needs in terms of organizational structure, policies/procedures, and capital enhancements. Develop strategic plans to obtain executive approval, define objectives, secure resources, and execute key milestones.Provide assessments and briefings to leadership, ensuring understanding of corrective actions, their impact, and urgency.Facilitate tabletop exercises for regional offices focused on emergency preparedness, crisis management, and resilience.Who You Are:Experienced in managing safety and security operations, ideally within a fast-paced technology environment, with a focus on developing security and safety programs and incident response plans.Skilled in managing all aspects of a physical security program, including but not limited to Executive Protection, Event Security, and Travel Security.Experienced in building and growing regional and global safety and security programs to scale with organizational needs.Knowledgeable about global technical security monitoring systems, with experience reviewing architectural plans and planning physical security design.Familiarity with enterprise physical security risk management principles, including conducting security and safety risk assessments and implementing mitigation strategies.Exceptional written and verbal communication skills to effectively convey security information across all levels of the organization with specific focus to executives.Strong vendor management capabilities, with a track record of managing and coordinating with external security vendors.10+ years of experience in corporate physical security and safety roles within a global security environment, with specific expertise in North and South American regions.5+ years as a fulltime people manager is essentialDatadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.Benefits and Growth:Generous and competitive benefits packageNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)Continuous career development opportunities Product training to develop understanding of our product and spaceBest in breed onboardingInternal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentallyFriendly and inclusive workplace cultureBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:$160,000—$210,000 USDAbout Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center.Equal Opportunity at Datadog:Datadog is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference. Datadog endeavors to make our Careers Page accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please complete this form. This form is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications. Privacy and AI Guidelines:Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice. For information on our AI policy, please visit Interviewing at Datadog AI Guidelines.Requisition ID: R16513
